name: Michael Keaton
description: American actor known for his roles in 'Beetlejuice', 'Batman' and 'Birdman'.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Michael Keaton was born on September 5, 1951, in Coraopolis, Pennsylvania, USA. He began his career in the entertainment industry in the mid-1970s, initially working in television, where he gained recognition for his comedic roles.

content.title: Career
content.body: Keaton's breakthrough role came in 1982 with the film **'Night Shift'**, directed by Ron Howard. He became a household name after starring in Tim Burton's 1989 **'Batman'** and its sequel **'Batman Returns'** in 1992. Known for his versatility, Keaton has received critical acclaim for his performances in **'Beetlejuice'**, **'Birdman'**, and **'Spotlight'**. His performance in 'Birdman' earned him a Golden Globe Award and an Academy Award nomination.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Michael Keaton frequently collaborated with director Tim Burton, notably on **'Beetlejuice'** and the **'Batman'** films. He has also worked with directors such as Ron Howard, Alejandro González Iñárritu, and Tom McCarthy.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Michael Keaton's portrayal of Batman is often credited with helping to redefine superhero films. His comeback in **'Birdman'** was celebrated as a career renaissance, and he continues to be a respected actor in Hollywood, with a significant impact on diverse genres including comedy, drama, and action.
